page.title: 12THE OLD BULL,INKBERROW.
page.content: The{OLD BULL},is the oldest pub in Inkberrow.It is in Church Street,near the village green.It was black and white but it has just been repainted cream.The local hunt meet here and all the huntsmen and the hounds stop on the car park while the people have a drink.Afternoon teas and morning coffee are served in the summer and you can get bar snacks at night.There are patio tables and chairs for you to sit outside in the sunshine.The lounge has just been enlarged.In the winter there is a lovely log fire. Inkberrow is supposed to be one of the villages used as a basis for the Radio 4 programme "The Archers",and the "Old Bull" is claimed to be the original of the pub in Ambridge.
